thread.title: PHOTOS: Public employee unions protest in Costa Rica
thread.title_full: PHOTOS: Public employee unions protest in Costa Rica -The Tico Times

author: Alberto Font
title: PHOTOS: Public employee unions protest in Costa Rica
text:
Some 100 public schools were closed Thursday so that teachers could attend the protest staged by public employee unions on Avenida Segunda, San José, August 20, 2015.
Alberto Font/The Tico Times
“No value added tax (VAT)” says a sign at the public employee protest in San José, August 20, 2015. President Luis Guillermo Solís recently presented a bill that would swap the country’s sales tax for a VAT tax.
Alberto Font/The Tico Times
Members of the National Association of Educators at the protest on Avenida Segunda, San José, August 20, 2015.
Alberto Font/The Tico Times
Nurses who work in the country’s public healthcare system joined the protest in San José, August 20, 2015.
Alberto Font/The Tico Times
Artisans who work in the 13th Street craft market in San José joined the protest. They concerned about being forcibly moved to a new location. President Solís presented a bill Thursday to maintain the arts and crafts market on 13th St., August 20, 2015.
Alberto Font/The Tico Times
Members of the High School Teachers’ Association attend the public employee protest in San José, August 20, 2015.
Alberto Font/The Tico Times
Traditional “gigantes” at the public employee protest in San José, August 20, 2015.
Alberto Font/The Tico Times
Members of the High School Teachers’ Association attend the public employee protest in San José, August 20, 2015.
Alberto Font/The Tico Times
Hundreds of public employees marched along the capital’s Second Avenue to the Legislative Assembly on Thursday, Aug. 20, 2015. There, union leaders delivered lawmakers a petition asking them to oppose a bill, the “Public Employment Law,” which would eliminate public workers’ extra-wage benefits and bonuses.
Alberto Font/The Tico Times
Hundreds of public employees marched along the capital’s Second Avenue to the Legislative Assembly in San José, August 20, 2015.
Alberto Font/The Tico Times
Members of the High School Teachers’ Association and the National Association of Educators attend the public employee protest along Avenida Segunda, San José, August 20, 2015.
Alberto Font/The Tico Times
Posters depicting lawmakers are carried at the protest in San José, August 20, 2015.
Alberto Font/The Tico Times
